body.name: Apevia ATX-SP700 Spirit ATX Power Supply with Auto-Thermally Controlled 120mm Fan, 115/230V Switch, All Protections
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Apevia 700W Spirit ATX Gaming Power Supply with black sandblasted casing
Supports Dual/Quad/Multi-core CPUs. Supports single 12V output for higher power usage.
Connectors: 1 x 20/24pin Main Power, 1 x 4+4pin 12V, 2 x PCI 6+2pin, 4 x SATA, 4 x Peripheral

IMPORTANT: The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on.

IMPORTANT: The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector.

IMPORTANT: The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector.

IMPORTANT: The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.2 4.2 out of 5 stars 330 ratings 4.2 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Apevia’s Spirit line of power supplies bring form and function to your system, providing high efficiency with a basic black look that fits ATX computer builds. It supports the modern 12v 2.3 power standard with a single 12V rail setup. Boasting a silent 120mm black fan, it keeps everything inside the system cool. Comes with enough cables to connect all the devices you might need. The ATX-SP700 power supply is perfect for mid-range builds for both business and gaming use. IMPORTANT: The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on. IMPORTANT: The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: for a cheaper psu... shows to produce close to what it states. no noise at all. i did the 500 or so and more than happy .... hopefully it lasts lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great power supply
reviews.reviewText: My old power supply died one day while I was playing video games and I didn't have a ton of money to get a new one. This power supply has been great and dose exactly what it should. It also came in very quickly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Amazing value for the money!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased an Apevia power supply that is almost exactly the same as this one in 2012-2013 for a rather serious (at the time) build. AMD FX-8150, R9 290. Yes, I did the classic "cheap out on the power supply" thing. Wouldn't you know, it lasted me all the way until a few months ago when I started to have issues with random restarts and such. I'd say I got my money's worth out of that $36 power supply. I was very surprised to see this power supply for sale 10 years after I bought the first one, for $36. Still. So of course I bought it again. It is working almost flawlessly, though the fan is a bit louder on this one and it only has one daisy chained PCI cable instead of the two the old one had.That being said, I wouldn't use this power supply on a build that costs any substantial money, as I did in the past. Juuuuust to be safe. Maybe I was just lucky. It's probably also super-inefficient compared to the new options available now, but hey. $36.Worked for me! Twice now. Happy customer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Performs fine for the money.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this power supply for an ITX build using an AMD 5700G APU. No video card, just an M.2 SSD and two SATA SSD's. The 5700g is 65 watts, so 700 watts seemed like a little overkill, but I figured I might be able get a solid 300 watts from this power supply since it is rather inexpensive an of unknown quality. So far all is well. I'm running distributed computing 24/7 with no issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 2 Apevia Power Supplies both Defective
reviews.reviewText: I ordered Apevia Power Supplies on two separate orders and Both were defective(EPS plug-ins on both PSUs). The last unit destroyed my digital PSU Tester. With the last defective PSU, Amazon first had me contact Apevia. Apevia's customer support is terrible. By the time Apevia would send out a replacement unit then it would be at least 10 days. Due to 2 New and Defective Apevia PSU units, the computer I was building was already on my work table for at least 10 days AND I would have to wait an extra 10 days for Apevia to send me another unit. The problem was with Apevia requiring me to ship it back to them and they had to process it, then ship out another unit. The Rep even checked on Amazon and saw I had ordered the PSU and saw that I received it the day I contacted them. I wanted Apevia to send one out right then and at the same time I would send the defective unit back to them. I even told Apevia that once I shipped it back and if they did not get the defective unit, then bill me for it. I just needed a working PSU - Fast. To finish this computer I traded locally for a working PSU. Due to Apevia's lack of customer support I will never buy another Apevia PSU. Unlike Apevia, Amazon issued a refund on the spot and to keep me from making and a hour round trip drive to UPS, Amazon told me dispose of it if I chose to do so. Thank You Amazon Rep Nali!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Go with this one if you are on a budget.
reviews.reviewText: I have used this 700 watt Apevia power supply for about 5 builds now, they all still work great. I tried the 500 watt Apevia and 600 watt Apevia several times and had to send most of them back because they were DOA. The 700 watt one for a few extra bucks is definitely worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this PSU after my old 330w gave out on me. Delivered quickly and exactly as advertised. Gives me more than twice the total power for under $40 and the cabling is neat and clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars This is louder than what I was expecting
reviews.reviewText: This power supply is pretty good voltage and wattage is expected and decent in terms of heat output. Only issues I can find is that the fan is easy louder than what I was expecting. I'll probably return it or change the fan if it gets annoyingly loud.
This PSU was great I have no complaints at all. I used it for about 6 months then upgraded just cause I needed more power but I went with a bigger apriva model. The company is 👍👍👍

I've had it for a little more than 5 months and used the PC fairly regularly. No issues to report thus far! I'm very happy for the price. I'm hoping that it will last a few of years but I'm happy if it lasts for 1 year at that price. It's not on the PSU list so I'm not expecting anything.
Se n’est pas le meilleur marque mais il fait la job.
Well made, voltage and amperage are stable and clean.Enough power to easily run two vid cards and an 8 core CPU.Perfect for my application.
